verses.verse: (A Psalm; a Song at the Dedication of the House. [A Psalm] of David.) I will <S%H7311>extol<s%> Thee, O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> for Thou hast <S%H1802>lifted<s%> me up, And hast not let my <S%H340>enemies<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> over me.
O <S%H3068>Lord<s%> my <S%H430>God,<s%> I <S%H7768>cried<s%> to Thee for <S%H7768>help,<s%> and Thou didst <S%H7495>heal<s%> me.

O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> Thou hast <S%H5927>brought<s%> up my <S%H5315>soul<s%> from <S%H7585>Sheol;<s%> Thou hast <S%H2421>kept<s%> me <S%H2421>alive,<s%> that I should not <S%H3381>go<s%> <S%H3381>down<s%> to the <S%H953>pit.<s%>
<S%H2167>Sing<s%> <S%H2167>praise<s%> to the <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> you His <S%H2623>godly<s%> <S%H2623>ones,<s%> And <S%H3034>give<s%> <S%H3034>thanks<s%> to His <S%H6944>holy<s%> <S%H2143>name.<s%>

For His <S%H639>anger<s%> is but for a <S%H7281>moment,<s%> His <S%H7522>favor<s%> is for a <S%H9132>lifetime;<s%> <S%H1065>Weeping<s%> may <S%H3885>last<s%> for the <S%H6153>night,<s%> But a <S%H7440>shout<s%> of <S%H7440>joy<s%> [comes] in the <S%H1242>morning.<s%>
Now as for me, I <S%H559>said<s%> in my <S%H7959>prosperity,<s%> "I will <S%H1077>never<s%> <S%H5769><s%> be <S%H4131>moved.<s%>"

O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> by Thy <S%H7522>favor<s%> Thou hast made my <S%H2022>mountain<s%> to <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H5797>strong;<s%> Thou didst <S%H5641>hide<s%> Thy <S%H6440>face,<s%> I was <S%H926>dismayed.<s%>
To Thee, O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> I <S%H7121>called,<s%> And to the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> I <S%H2603>made<s%> supplication: <S%H2603><s%>

<S%H4100>"What<s%> <S%H1215>profit<s%> is there in my <S%H1818>blood,<s%> if I <S%H3381>go<s%> <S%H3381>down<s%> to the <S%H7845>pit<s%>? Will the <S%H6083>dust<s%> <S%H3034>praise<s%> Thee? Will it <S%H5046>declare<s%> Thy <S%H571>faithfulness<s%>?
<S%H8085>"Hear,<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> and be <S%H2603>gracious<s%> to me; O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> be Thou my <S%H5826>helper.<s%>"
Thou hast <S%H2015>turned<s%> for me my <S%H4553>mourning<s%> into <S%H4234>dancing;<s%> Thou hast <S%H6605>loosed<s%> my <S%H8242>sackcloth<s%> and <S%H247>girded<s%> me with <S%H8057>gladness;<s%>

That [my] <S%H9202>soul<s%> may <S%H2167>sing<s%> <S%H2167>praise<s%> to Thee, and not be <S%H1826>silent.<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord<s%> my <S%H430>God,<s%> I will <S%H3034>give<s%> <S%H3034>thanks<s%> to Thee <S%H5769>forever.<s%>
